content:
Hey! I often find myself accidentally clicking on a stream in Recent topics when I was actually trying to go to the topic.

Do folks find it useful to have stream links from the Recent topics view, or could we just have clicking anywhere on the row (other than the mute button, etc.) go to the topic? CC @Greg Price who suggested this idea.
I rarely use stream narrows for anything. So, this is a welcome change for me.

Cool, I filed #22159.

@shlok patel (madrix01) along with this change, we should have all the links in PM conversation rows go to the PM conversation, not to the interleaved PMs view.
Can I take up this issue now or after merging PM in recent topics?
@shlok patel (madrix01) you're welcome to work on this one now if you are interested; hopefully it's relatively quick. You can separtely update the PMs PR with the new approach.
#20890 is already updated, will make PR with topic links soon.
Didn't we have a project to potentially make the whole row be a click target going to the topic? @Gaurav Pandey (ligmitz) do you remember the details around that?
I remember seeing work on changing what parts of the row are click targets, but I thought the stream column always linked to the stream. I could be wrong.
We have an issue to link timestamps to the latest message in the topic using a near link with a pending PR. Apart from that, I'm not quite aware of any other plans.

As noted in https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/22160#issuecomment-1198713602, we ended up deciding to instead try having the stream links in "Recent topics" filter to just that stream as the design direction.

(So we'll likely include this idea in the work to add support for filtering to individual streams in Recent topics)
